title: Red Alert: Critical flood situations in low-lying areas of 6 major rivers
byline: The Irrigation Department warned that that critical flood situations have already developed in the low-lying areas of the relevant river basins of six major rivers, and that water levels are expected to rise further.

title: Red Alert: Major flood situation in low-lying areas of Kelani River Basin
byline: The Irrigation Department warns that a major flood situation is likely to occur within the next 48 hours in the low-lying areas of the Kelani River valley.

title: Heavy showers and strong winds to continue due to Cyclone “Ditwah”
byline: The Cyclonic storm “Ditwah” is centered near latitude 7.7°N and longitude 81.5°E, about 20km Southwest of Batticaloa and it is very likely to move northnorthwestwards today (28), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: All train services suspended due to bad weather
byline: The Railway Department has announced that train services on all routes have been suspended after 6:00 a.m. today (28), owing to the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Several BIA-bound flights diverted due to adverse weather
byline: At least three flights bound to Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) have been diverted to the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Level 3 landslide evacuation warning issued to 7 districts extended
byline: The ‘Level-3’ (Red) landslide evacuation warning issued for multiple areas in seven districts has been extended.

title: CSE to close early due to adverse weather
byline: Regular trading at the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) will be halted early today (28) due to the adverse weather prevailing across the country, the CSE announced.

title: Death toll due to adverse weather climbs to 56 with over 20 missing
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reports that 46 deaths have been recorded within the past 72 hours as adverse weather conditions continue to affect the island.

title: Highest rainfall in past 24 hours recorded in Gammaduwa, Matale
byline: The highest rainfall within the last 24 hours has been reported from Gammaduwa in Matale, with rainfall levels recording 540 mm.

title: Heavy rainfall and gusty winds to continue across the island due to Cyclone ‘Ditwah’
byline: The Cyclonic Storm “Ditwah” is centered near latitude 8.1°N and longitude 81.2°E, about 50km South of Trincomalee and it is very likely to move north-northwestwards, the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Bus with around 70 passengers stuck on Kalawewa Bridge
byline: A bus carrying around 70 passengers has been stranded on the Kalawewa Bridge along the Anuradhapura–Puttalam road due to rising flood waters.

title: SJB’s Ismail Muththu Mohamed resigns as MP
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Parliamentarian Ismail Muththu Mohamed has announced his resignation from his position as a Member of Parliament.

title: Colombo-Kandy main road closed in Kegalle due to landslide risk
byline: A section of the Colombo-Kandy main road has been closed between the 88 km and 89 km mile posts in Meepitiya, Kegalle, due to the risk of landslides.

title: Six Sri Lanka-bound flights diverted due to adverse weather
byline: Due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions in Sri Lanka, six flights bound to the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) have been diverted to Mattala, Trivandrum, and Cochin airports, BIA officials said. ,

title: SriLankan Airlines advises passengers to check flight status before arriving at airport
byline: SriLankan Airlines has announced the passengers to check the latest flight status before arriving at the airport, as adverse weather conditions continue to affect the island.
